intro: Brassica rapa convar. europea, commonly known as field mustard, is an annual or biennial plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lobed or oval leaves and yellow flowers arranged in racemes. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and is native to Europe and parts of Asia. It produces small, round pods containing several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This species is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including fields and roadsides.
